description: Minimal number of disjoint edge-paths into which the graph of the n-ary cube can be partitioned.
comments: The formula for this sequence is easily derived from a generalization of Euler's famous "Eulerian Path" theorem (see Theorem 11.2.4 in p. 419 of the reference).
references: R. A. Brualdi, Introductory Combinatorics, 3rd ed. Prentice-Hall, 1999.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..400
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,5,0,-4).
example: a(5)=16 because 2^(5-1)=16. Consequently, the minimal number of disjoint edge-paths into which the 5-ary cube can be partitioned is 16.
mathematica: Table[If[EvenQ[n],1,2^(n-1)],{n,80}] (* or *) Riffle[2^(2Range[0,50]),1] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 02 2011 *)
author: Felix Golderg (felixg(AT)tx.technion.ac.il), Jan 19 2001
extensions: More terms from _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 02 2011
